title: You're Using Sub-Agents Wrong: 90% of Developers Are Sabotaging Their AI Workflows
author: ameno
description: After 20+ hours of testing, discover why most developers use Claude Code sub-agents completely backwards—and the simple architectural shift that reduces tokens by 80% while improving code quality.

source.videoTitle: I was using sub-agents wrong... Here is my way after 20+ hrs test

callouts.insight: Sub-agents excel as researchers, not implementers. Context isolation kills implementation. Research summaries enable it.
callouts.data: Token Reduction: ~80%. Before: 80% context consumed before work starts. After: Few hundred tokens per research task. Result: Conversation compaction PREVENTED.
callouts.warning: Implementation delegation WILL fail. Without proper context management: Sub-agents work in isolation, Parent agent loses visibility, Integration becomes impossible, Debugging is a nightmare. Use sub-agents for RESEARCH ONLY.

implementationChecklist: Choose one service for specialized agent
coreInsights: Sub-agents work best as researchers, not implementers
Context engineering saves more tokens than actual implementation
File system is ultimate context management across agents
Specialized agents need domain-specific documentation embedded
Parent agents lose implementation context without proper sharing
Research phases dramatically improve final coding output quality
Token optimization matters more than execution speed initially
Documentation retrieval beats conversation history for persistence
Agent orchestration requires explicit context file maintenance
Implementation delegation fails without proper information architecture
automationOpportunities: Specialized service agents (Vercel, Stripe, Shadcn, Supabase, Tailwind)
